subject: ServerTestCase and Destination Unreachable

messageBody:
I am trying to convert my junit test classes from extending TestCase
to extending ServerTestCase. I'm doing this because we have a bunch
of back-end code that has been converted to use Transactions,
therefore, in order to test it, we need to run it in an app server.
We're using WebLogic 7.1. BTW, the back-end code works when running
in the app server called from our Struts front-end.

When I run ant to compile and run the junit test classes (now
extending ServerTestCase) I get the following:

javax.naming.CommunicationException. Root exception is
java.net.ConnectException: t3://localhost:7001: Destination
unreachable; nested exception is:
java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect; No available
router to destination

I tried to run the testcase from the command prompt like 'java
MyTestCase' I get the same result. It looks like the code is running
outside the app server. I thought ServerTestCase was supposed to put
our code into an EJB running in the app server. Obviously, I'm consfused.

How can I get my code to run in the app server using junit?
